Elements

The fully customized and customizable parts of the framework.

Alerts

Alerts can serve to make sure users can see important messages on their screen. Simply create a block of code and stylize it accordingly. Start off by adding an alert class to a <div> tag, and then specify which type of alert you want by adding the second class, alert--$type, where $type is either one of the following: default, info, success, warning, or danger.

Example:

This is a default alert. This is an info alert. This is a success alert. This is a warning alert. This is a danger alert.
<alert class="alert [alert--$type]">
    // Body of Element
</alert>

Buttons

One of the most essential elements in a CSS framework: buttons. Sparkle allows you to style anchor tags, div tags, and buttons by simply putting button in its class. This is also the first step to style a button accordingly (see other styling below).

Example:

Button
<input type="button" class="button [button--$type]" value="">
<a href="#" class="button [button--$type]"></a>
<button class="button [button--$type]></button>

Example:

Default
Primary
Secondary
Success
Warning
Danger
Light
Dark
<button class="button>Button</button>
<button class="button button--primary></button>
<button class="button button--secondary></button>
<button class="button button--success></button>
<button class="button button--warning></button>
<button class="button button--danger></button>
<button class="button button--light></button>
<button class="button button--dark></button>

Example:

Primary
Secondary
Success
Warning
Danger
Light
Dark
<button class="button button--primary--outline></button>
<button class="button button--secondary--outline></button>
<button class="button button--success--outline></button>
<button class="button button--warning--outline></button>
<button class="button button--danger--outline></button>
<button class="button button--light--outline></button>
<button class="button button--dark--outline></button>

Example:

Secondary

Warning
Danger
Light

<button class="button button--primary--ghost></button>
<button class="button button--secondary--ghost></button>
<button class="button button--success--ghost></button>
<button class="button button--warning--ghost></button>
<button class="button button--danger--ghost></button>
<button class="button button--light--ghost></button>
<button class="button button--dark--ghost></button>

Example:

X-Small
Small
Medium
Large
X-Large
<button class="button button--xsmall></button>
<button class="button button--small></button>
<button class="button button--medium></button>
<button class="button button--large></button>
<button class="button button--xlarge></button>

Example:

Block
<button class="button button--block></button>
